ngiemboon: Pi púɔ Ssé, e Ssé kwoŋo gẅí tɛʼ, púʼu la, pi pí fʉ̀ʼ na yé.
en: Therefore, be imitators of God, as dearly loved children,

ngiemboon: Pi gwaa gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gí wɔ́ɔ, ńdɔg pɔ́ nkwòŋe, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ Keleto la kwoŋo wégè tà ńnáa twó yé ńdɔg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ mvfò Ssé ńtíi wégè. Epwɔʼ ŋwɛ́, ée gẅie agyě poŋo mbwó Ssé.
en: and walk in love, as Christ also loved us and gave himself for us,   a sacrificial and fragrant offering to God.

ngiemboon: Páʼ pi ee fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé la, etsɔ́ shúm ée sie á té zɛ́te ngie nyìŋ gẅi gÿo wɔ́, ńgíŋ te zɛ́te ngie mé zɔɔn ńkím mbɔɔ kǐm tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́: mé gɔɔn nò páʼ mbàŋa létóŋ panzwě, é panzwě léfaʼ mbàŋa, á mmó páʼ menò ncÿǒ, mbɔɔ nò kegɔ̀ʼ.
en: But sexual immorality   and any impurity  # 5:3 1Th 4:7 or greed  # 5:3 Lk 12:15; Rm 1:29; Eph 4:19; Col 3:5; 1Th 2:5; 2Pt 2:3,14 should not even be heard of  # 5:3 Or be named among you, as is proper for saints.

ngiemboon: Á té zɛ́te ngie pi shwóŋe mag mag wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ lémaʼa kwaŋ na tsɔ̌ ntí, lâ légÿo tsɔ́ ntí megʉa. Á poŋ ngie ashwóŋè gwaa kẅɛɛ ncwò pi, pi lɔgɔ síe pɔ́ Ssé na mmó gie à gÿǒ mbwó pi.
en: Obscene and foolish talking or crude joking are not suitable, but rather giving thanks.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie, mámbàŋa gẅie à tóŋo panzwě, kà manzwě gẅie à faʼa mbàŋa wɔ́ɔ, mbɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo menò ncÿǒ, tà mbɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie à zába ntʉ́m na shúm pʉ̀a, atsɔ́ wɔb těen ńdáʼa ńgẅiin yé jʉʼ tsɛ̀ɛ nò lefùɔ Keleto pɔ́ Ssé wɔ́. Lezǎb ntʉ́m na shúm pʉ̀a, e gwɔ̌ pɔ́ tsɔ̌ ntí leguʼte shúm ńdɔg ngie ee Ssé.
en: For know and recognize this: Every sexually immoral   or impure  # 5:5 2Co 6:17 or greedy  # 5:5 1Co 5:10–11; 6:10 person, who is an idolater, does not have an inheritance in the kingdom  # 5:5 Mk 1:15 of Christ and of God.

ngiemboon: Tà nyìŋ lɔgɔ púu shwóŋè, éfʉʉ gẅí. Menò mie mé tʉ́ʉ lɔɔn zɔɔn ńgÿo, e Ssé gyáŋa lóŋ ńtí pʉ̀a pie é té gÿo mmó gie à ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́.
en: Let no one deceive you with empty arguments, for God’s wrath   is coming on the disobedient  # 5:6 Lit sons of disobedience because of these things.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, tà pi lâ yɛ̌ ntí pʉ̀a teme tsɔ́ nò.
en: Therefore, do not become their partners.

ngiemboon: Pi kaa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm. Á cʉa na páʼ pi kéen ńda nnɛ́ na Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, pi cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉʼʉ fɔ̌g. Púʼu la, pi gwaa gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gí wɔ́ɔ, ńgÿo páʼ pʉ̀a pie ée na jʉʼʉ fɔ̌g.
en: For you were once darkness, but now you are light   in the Lord. Walk as children of light  # 5:8 Is 2:5; Lk 16:8; Jn 12:35–36  #— #

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn púʼu, mélàʼmie, apìi légwɔ́ jʉʼʉ fɔ̌g, aa legÿo menò mbòŋo, ńgÿo menò mie ée mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ, ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ nò nénʉ́.
en: for the fruit of the light   consists of all goodness, righteousness, and truth  # 5:9 Eph 5:17  #— #

ngiemboon: Pi gwaa gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ, ńtaʼ menò, lézsé mie é poŋo mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: testing   what is pleasing  # 5:10 Lk 18:18 to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kúu nùɔ pʉ̀a pie é faʼa mefàʼ mie é té kẅéte, é mefàʼ nzěm. Pi shʉashʉa ńkyag nzèm yɔb kyag.
en: Don’t participate in the fruitless   works of darkness, but instead expose them.

ngiemboon: Menò mie pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ gÿo tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm, ée menò shʉ́, ńzɔɔn te mie ngwɔ́ nyìŋ kím mbɔɔ kǐm wɔ́.
en: For it is shameful even to mention what is done by them in secret.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn shʉashʉa ńkyag mɛ̌ menò ntsèm, mbà é ge fɔ́g
en: Everything exposed by the light is made visible,

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn te gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndàʼ púʼu wɔ́, ammó vɔg tà ńkẅɛɛ jʉʼʉ fɔ̌g, ńkúbe, ńcʉ́ʼ ńkyɛʼ pɔ́ jʉʼ. Áa yɛ̌ tá mé gɔɔn ngie:
en: for what makes everything visible is light. Therefore it is said:

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, pi gwaa gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gí wɔ́ɔ, ńdaga twó gí mboŋó. Pi pɔ́ɔn lenéŋè we megʉ̀gʉ̀, pi néŋe páʼ megàŋa zsénò
en: Pay careful attention, then, to how you walk #— #not as unwise people but as wise #— #

ngiemboon: pie é zsé lézẅɛ́ʼ melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mie Ssé náa mbwó pɔ́b, éfaʼ mefàʼ mbòŋo, á nue afʉ̀ʼʉ njÿó yɔɔn té ne ḿboŋo wɔ́.
en: making the most of the time,  ,# 5:16 Col 4:5 because the days are evil.

ngiemboon: Púʼu, tà pi gwɔ́ megʉ̀gʉ̀. Pi taʼ menò lézsé mie é poŋo mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: So don’t be foolish, but understand   what the Lord’s will  # 5:17 Ps 143:10; Pr 16:9; Gl 1:4; Eph 1:9 is.

ngiemboon: Tà pi nú melùʼ tà é jÿó gẅí. Legÿo púʼu, aa lecʉmé na mánzsè tepòŋ. Azẅìge ndʉalʉ̌a zɔ pú ńjÿó gẅí.
en: And don’t get drunk   with wine,  # 5:18 Gn 9:21; Dt 7:13; Ps 4:7; Pr 3:10; Lk 5:37 which leads to reckless living, but be filled by the Spirit:  # 5:18 Lk 1:15; Ac 13:52

ngiemboon: Púʼu, pi ne ńzɔbɔ mezɔ̀bɔ ntse mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne ńdɔgɔ ńkẅiŋte mennɛ́ mí, ńzɔb mezɔ̀b pʉ̀a Keleto, ńzɔb mezɔ̀b mie Zẅìge Ssé neŋé ntʉ́m pi. Pi zɔb ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a né ngwòŋ ntʉ́m gẅí ntsèm.
en: speaking to one another in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and making music with your heart to the Lord,

ngiemboon: Pi lɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Keleto ńne síe Ssé Tá, á fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, á na shúm ntsèm.
en: giving thanks always for everything to God the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ,

ngiemboon: Pi lɔg páʼ pi ná mbùm gi ssé mvfò Keleto, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná mbùm ye ssé mvfò fɛ̌ we.
en: submitting to one another in the fear of Christ.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na pi panzwě, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná mbùm ye ssé mvfò ndúm we, páʼ à náa mbùm ye ssé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la.
en: Wives,   submit  # 5:22 Other mss omit submit,# 5:22 Gn 3:16; 1Co 11:3,7–9,11–12; Col 3:18; Ti 2:4–5; 1Pt 3:1–6 to your husbands  # 5:22 1Pt 3:1 as to the Lord,

ngiemboon: Á nue ndúm manzwě aa twó, manzwě gwɔ́ mbùm nnɛ́. Keleto aa twó, acúʼtè pʉ̀a pé gwɔ́ mbùm nnɛ́. Yé zɔ gÿo tá cúʼtè pʉ̀a pé gẅiin legwɔ́ temì.
en: because the husband is the head of the wife   as Christ is the head  # 5:23 Col 2:10 of the church. He is the Savior of the body.  # 5:23 Col 3:18–4:1

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto ne ńnáa mbùm ye ssé mvfò Keleto la, á zɛ́te ngie à gʉa na pi panzwě, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná mbùm ye ssé mvfò ndúm we pɔ́ púʼu.
en: Now as the church submits to Christ, so also wives are to submit to their husbands in everything.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na pi mbàŋa, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ kwoŋo nzwě we ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ Keleto kwoŋo cúʼtè pʉ̀a pé tà mbà à la náa twó yé ńtí yɛ̌,
en: Husbands, love your wives,   just as Christ loved  # 5:25 Jn 3:16; 1Co 13:1; 2Th 2:13 the church and gave himself  # 5:25 Ti 2:14 for her

ngiemboon: ńgÿo púʼu, ńdɔg faga cúʼtè yé ńnáa mbwó Ssé. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà à lɔ̌g ntse sɔgɔ wɔ́b, ńgíŋ ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè ńkẅile ncÿǒ na pɔ́b.
en: to make her holy, cleansing   her with the washing of water by the word.

ngiemboon: À la ne ńkwoŋo ngie yɛ̌ cúʼtè gwaa tyé mvfò yé, ńcwoŋo ńne ńŋwʉŋe, ńgwɔ́ té ncÿǒ, té tsɔ́ jʉʼʉ nnɛ́ yé ńŋúʼte, té tsɔ́ lɔ̌ʼ, atsɔ́ mmó le nyé ńzága na yé wɔ́.
en: He did this to present the church to himself in splendor, without spot or wrinkle or anything like that, but holy and blameless.

ngiemboon: Púʼu, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mámbàŋa kwoŋo nzwě we yé páʼ à kwoŋo twó mbùm yé. Nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋo nzwě we la, à kwoŋo pɔ́ twó mbùm yé.
en: In the same way, husbands are to love their wives as their own bodies. He who loves his wife loves himself.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ laa zɔɔn ḿbʉa mbùm ye wɔ́. Nyìŋ jÿɔ́g mbùm ye jÿɔ̌g ḿbiŋ ńnyɛte. Áa ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ Yěsô Keleto gÿo na cúʼtè pʉ̀a pé púʼu,
en: For no one ever hates his own flesh but provides and cares for it, just as Christ does for the church,

ngiemboon: á nue pege gwɔ̌ pɔ́ mekèm mbùm ye.
en: since we are members of his body.

ngiemboon: «Áa mmó gie á gÿo mámbàŋa néŋe tà fag nnɛ́ ye na tá we pɔ́ má we, ńgʉa ńda nnɛ́ na wemanzwě, pɔ́ ye temte ńcʉ́ʼʉ tàʼ mbab nnɛ́.»
en: For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife,    and the two will become one flesh.   # 5:31 Gn 2:24,# 5:31 Gn 2:24

ngiemboon: Eyɔɔn ntsem ee wó tɛʼ, n gɔɔn páʼɔɔn na Keleto mbɔɔ na cúʼtè pʉ̀a pé.
en: This mystery   is profound, but I am talking about Christ and the church.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn mbɔɔ na pi gí. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ mámbàŋa wɔ́ɔ kwoŋo nzwě we páʼ à kwoŋo twó mbùm yé, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ manzwě wɔ́ɔ gÿo mekùʼ ndúm we.
en: To sum up, each one of you is to love his wife as himself, and the wife is to respect her husband.
